entities.name: EARTH
entities.description: The planet around which satellites orbit to perform various functions such as communication, weather monitoring, and scientific research

entities.name: COMMUNICATION SATELLITE
entities.description: A type of satellite used to relay signals for television, internet, phone calls, and other forms of communication

entities.name: WEATHER SATELLITE
entities.description: A type of satellite equipped with sensors and cameras to monitor Earth's weather patterns and provide data for meteorologists

entities.name: GEOSTATIONARY ORBIT (GEO)
entities.description: An orbit where satellites remain fixed over a specific point on the equator, commonly used for telecommunications and broadcasting

entities.name: LOW EARTH ORBIT (LEO)
entities.description: An orbit closer to Earth, used for tasks like Earth observation, remote sensing, and satellite internet

entities.name: POLAR ORBIT
entities.description: An orbit that passes over the Earth's poles, used for Earth observation and weather monitoring

entities.name: EARTH STATION
entities.description: A ground station that communicates with satellites through radio signals

entities.name: CUBESAT
entities.description: A small satellite that is revolutionizing the satellite industry by reducing costs and increasing accessibility for educational institutions, startups, and developing countries

entities.name: ELECTRIC PROPULSION SYSTEM
entities.description: A system enabling satellites to maneuver more efficiently in space and extend their operational lifetimes

entities.name: LASER COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY
entities.description: A technology being developed to increase the data transmission rates between satellites and ground stations, enabling faster and more reliable communication

entities.name: PAYLOAD
entities.description: The equipment or instruments on a satellite that perform its primary function

entities.name: BUS
entities.description: The structure of a satellite that houses the payload and provides power, communication, and control systems

entities.name: SOLAR PANELS
entities.description: Components of a satellite that convert sunlight into electricity to operate its systems and charge its batteries

entities.name: RADIO SIGNALS
entities.description: Signals used to communicate with satellites from Earth stations

entities.name: TELECOMMUNICATIONS
entities.description: Industry that uses satellites to provide global connectivity, especially in remote and rural areas

entities.name: METEOROLOGY
entities.description: Field that uses weather satellites to track storms, monitor climate patterns, and issue timely warnings for natural disasters

entities.name: SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH
entities.description: Field that uses satellites to study the Earth's climate, oceans, atmosphere, and land cover

entities.name: MINIATURIZATION
entities.description: Advancement in technology that is making satellites more capable and affordable

entities.name: PROPULSION
entities.description: Technology that enables satellites to maneuver in space

entities.name: ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING
entities.description: Field that uses satellites to monitor the Earth's health and support conservation efforts

entities.name: EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS
entities.description: Organizations that benefit from the reduced costs and increased accessibility of CubeSats

entities.name: STARTUPS
entities.description: Companies that benefit from the reduced costs and increased accessibility of CubeSats

entities.name: DEVELOPING COUNTRIES
entities.description: Nations that benefit from the reduced costs and increased accessibility of CubeSats

relations: Communication satellites orbit the Earth to relay signals for various forms of communication
Weather satellites orbit the Earth to monitor weather patterns and provide data for meteorologists
Geostationary satellites orbit the Earth at the same speed as Earth's rotation, remaining fixed over a specific point on the equator
Low Earth orbit satellites orbit closer to Earth and are used for tasks like Earth observation and satellite internet
Polar orbit satellites pass over the Earth's poles, used for Earth observation and weather monitoring
CubeSats orbit the Earth and are used for various tasks, reducing costs and increasing accessibility
Satellites orbit the Earth to perform various functions
Earth stations communicate with communication satellites through radio signals
The telecommunications industry uses communication satellites to provide global connectivity
Earth stations communicate with weather satellites through radio signals
Meteorologists use weather satellites to track storms, monitor climate patterns, and issue timely warnings
Laser communication technology is being developed to increase the data transmission rates between satellites and Earth stations
Radio signals are used to communicate with satellites from Earth stations
Advancements in miniaturization are making CubeSats more capable and affordable
Educational institutions benefit from the reduced costs and increased accessibility of CubeSats
Startups benefit from the reduced costs and increased accessibility of CubeSats
Developing countries benefit from the reduced costs and increased accessibility of CubeSats
Electric propulsion systems enable satellites to maneuver more efficiently in space and extend their operational lifetimes
Propulsion technology, such as electric propulsion systems, enables satellites to maneuver more efficiently in space
The payload is the equipment or instruments on a satellite that perform its primary function
The bus is the structure of a satellite that houses the payload and provides power, communication, and control systems
Solar panels on satellites convert sunlight into electricity to operate their systems and charge their batteries
Scientists use research satellites to study the Earth's climate, oceans, atmosphere, and land cover
Environmental monitoring is a key application of scientific research satellites
